instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ppbus
threads.message:
It was a liquid damage board, the spill was around <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> area.
i have cleaned and replaced all components, there is a short on system side of l7130, i haven't looked into yet as i was trying to get ppbus before hunting that short, so long story short i have replaced all components including <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but i still get 15.80 volts instead of 12.56 on pin 1 of l7130.
resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 is 3 and 20 ohms.
i have compared values to working board and pin 21 of isl have around .8 volts on working board and non working have 0 on it.
what else should i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ppbus
threads.message:
L7130 is part of buck controller.
You cannot get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> if L7130 is lifted...
Pull out F7140 and check which side the short remains.
BTW, which is the exact value of that "short"?
Check if any big coil (secondary supply) has the same value, in respect with ground.

Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is in place, or you can risk to fry <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> again...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ppbus
threads.message: If you have 15 volts, I don't think you can possibly have a short...if you're worried on that removed F7140 and see if there is a low resistance reading on either side of the fuse. 16 volts means, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted and always open. If this is the problem, replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time.
